Traps follow a set of special rules.

At the start of the conﬂict scene, you may spend a number of IP equal to the desired Trap 【 SL 】. If you do, choose one option and deploy it before the start of the ﬁrst round:

Effect size

IP cost

MP cost

Targets

Minor

Trap 【SL】

5

One creature

Medium

Trap 【SL】

10

Major

Trap 【SL】

15

Three creatures

Choose your targets. The aﬀected creatures perform an Opposed 【 DEX + INS 】 Check against you. You gain a bonus equal to 【 SL 】 on this Check. Creatures that succeed escape the trap. Unless otherwise stated, traps may only be deployed at the start of a conﬂict scene.

However, if the surprise round optional rule (see Core Rulebook) is active, traps can also be set outside of combat to ambush unaware enemies. If you choose to use them in this way, you cannot place them again at the start of the conﬂict scene.

Example. Eshe and his party spot a DARK patrol near an alley. As conﬂict begins, he spends 3 IP (Poison Dart’s associated 【 SL 】) and 10 MP to deploy a Medium Poison Dart Trap, targeting two agents. Both targets perform an Opposed 【 DEX + INS 】 Check against Eshe’s 【 DEX + INS 】 +4 (his current Set Trap SL). One agent fails, suﬀering 【 HR + 10 】 poison and the poisoned status. The other agent succeeds and is unaﬀected.

TYPES OF TRAPS

【SL 1】

Tripwire. You set up a simple wire attached to two points to detect movement and trip your target. In non-conﬂict scenes, this trap alerts allies of incoming enemies. In combat, the target suffers 【 HR + 10 】 physical damage. Describe your contraption and the sound it makes!

Siren. Once triggered, this trap emits a loud noise designed to distract foes. In non-conﬂict scenes, you set a timer that expires at your discretion, and aﬀected creatures must immediately move toward the source of the sound upon activation. In combat, there is no timer, and aﬀected creatures suffer dazed.

Smoke bomb. You set up a canister or pouch ﬁlled with substances that release a thick, obscuring smoke designed to cloud visibility and confuse foes. The aﬀected target suffers a -2 penalty to all its Accuracy Checks within a full round. If the target has already taken any turn during the round the trap was deployed, the eﬀect begins at the start of the next round.

【SL 2】

Snare Net. This trap, when triggered, swiftly ensnares the target. Affected creatures must spend an action escaping it. On top of that, if the creature is flying, it falls to the ground for one round, suffering 【 HR + 10 】 physical damage.

Blinding Powder. This trap creates a burst of powder that clouds the targets’ vision. Each aﬀected creature suffers dazed and slow.

Mocking Trap. You set up a weird contraption that taunts your target. Aﬀected creatures now suffer enraged.

【SL 3】

Poison Dart. You set up a hidden mechanism that, when activated, shoots a concealed dart at the target, coated with a potent toxin. The target suffers 【HR + 10】 poison damage and the poisoned status.

Snap Out. This electrifying trap releases a sudden electrical discharge that jolts the targets upon activation. Shocked creatures suffer 【 HR + 10 】 bolt damage and a -2 penalty to all its Accuracy Checks within a full round. If the target has already taken any turn during the round the trap was deployed, the eﬀect begins at the start of the next round.

Sting Thing. Hidden spikes burst upward when triggered, piercing the target. Choose one damage type: physical, bolt, or poison. The aﬀected target suffers 【HR + 15】 damage of the chosen type.

【SL 4】

Bear Trap. You create a powerful spring-loaded bear trap with razor-sharp teeth, capable of snapping shut on the target's limb, maiming it. The design is very human. Affected targets suffer 【 HR + 20 】 physical damage and the slow status.

Moth Trap. This trap releases a searing ﬂash of intense radiance upon activation. Affected creatures suffer 【HR + 15】 light damage and a penalty of 【 SL 】 to all its Accuracy Checks within a full round. If the target has already taken any turn during the round the trap was deployed, the eﬀect begins at the start of the next round.

Fly Trap. This trap releases a sticky substance that inhibits movement. Creatures caught in it lose one action to free themselves and suffer slow. On top of that, if the creature is ﬂying, it falls to the ground for two rounds, suffering 【HR + 10】 physical damage and the slow status.

【SL 5】

Explosive Trap. When triggered, this trap releases a concussive explosion. Targets caught in the blast suffer 【 HR + 25 】 ﬁre damage.

Venomous Cloud. When triggered, this trap releases a ﬁne mist of corrosive venom that clings to the skin and burns into the ﬂesh. The aﬀected creatures suffer 【 HR + 20 】 poison damage and the poisoned status.

Soul Mirror. You craft a reﬂective contraption laced with ritualistic runes that shimmers brightly when triggered. Aﬀected creatures suffer a magical backlash as their next oﬀensive ( @ICON[offensive] ) spell is redirected toward them.
